The Care Manager gathers options and services to meet an individual's and family's comprehensive health needs.   The Care Manager communicates with all members of the team, patient, and family members to align resources that promote safety, quality outcomes, and cost efficiency.  The weekend Care Manager uses their care coordination knowledge and professional background to prioritize cases and align transition planning to promote efficiency along the care continuum; contributing to the attainment of organizational goals.  The role directly impacts patient care and outcomes:
- Coordinates interdisciplinary care for a caseload of patients for their trajectory across the care continuum; taking into consideration the age and development needs of the patient as well as the social determinants of health.
- Is responsible for the interdisciplinary coordination of patient care as established by critical paths or psychological/social/practical care, managed care contracts, and individualized interdisciplinary plans of care; engaging resources across all layers of the health care landscape (i.e. payer resources/Case Managers/programs, community resources, health system resources, etc.)
- Mobilizes resources and manages the system(s) in order to respond to concurrent and retrospective variances according to the Interdisciplinary individualized plan of care.
- Maintains knowledge of and responds to clinical system, and fiscal data related to specific patient populations.

Description and Requirements:
Position Overview: 
This executive role leads and manages the clinical operations and improvement initiatives for Perioperative Services at The Johns Hopkins Hospital.  In this capacity, the Director is responsible for achieving established quality, safety, productivity, efficiency, financial and patient satisfaction performance parameters in the perioperative arena.  The position works closely with surgical department Chairs, nursing and other stakeholders to design, implement, and manage initiatives aimed at optimizing quality, efficiency and profitability of the surgical care delivery system.
In addition, this role collaborates with leadership across the Johns Hopkins Health System for regional and system-wide organization of hospital and ambulatory surgery center operating rooms, and serves serves as the physician lead for the Baltimore regional OR governance structure.  
Reporting Relationship 
Reports to the EVP/Chief Operating Officer, JHH, and has indirect reporting relationship to the Surgeon-in-Chief, and the Director for Anesthesia and Critical Care Medicine for JHH; also reports to the Surgeon in Chief of Johns Hopkins Medicine.  Position has oversight for the following:
At the Johns Hopkins Hospital: 
 Central Sterile  Scope Processing  Perfusion Services (operational )  Supply Chain related to the procurement and distribution of equipment, materials and supplies  OR Scheduling, Assistant Director of Nursing for Surgical Services and the Assistant Director of Nursing for Prep/PACU (co-managed with Sr Director for Nursing)  Perioperative Informatics (team will have specific deliverables to Director)  Perioperative financial reporting and analysis (will have dedicated finance manager, co-managed by Surgery and Anesthesia Director of Finance)  
At the Johns Hopkins Bayview Medical Center
 Jointly oversees the perioperative services director for Johns Hopkins Bayview. 
For the Johns Hopkins Health System
 Serves as a member of the JHHS regional governance committee for Perioperative services. 
Qualifications: 
 A current Maryland M.D. /R.N. license (If don’t have able to obtain); Board certification in general surgery, a surgical specialty or anesthesiology if a physician; a Master’s Degree if a nurse. M.D. license strongly preferred.  Demonstrated expertise in running an efficient, high quality, complex surgical enterprise with specific experience in dealing with clinical and administrative issues related to perioperative services in a large academic environment. Proven leadership and communication skills.  The analytic ability necessary to resolve extremely complex short and long term problems requiring the application of both clinical and management principles. The ability to promote and maintain good interpersonal relationships; proficiency in team building, conflict resolution, and group interaction.  Proven ability to manage and work proactively with large diverse groups of individuals.  Experience in process improvement, medical informatics, business and medicine, or health care administration.  
Principal Duties and Responsibilities: 
For the Johns Hopkins Hospital:
This 1.0 FTE full-time position is encouraged to maintain some, limited clinical presence in the JHH ORs, though this is not strictly required and may be adjusted over time.  
 Manages and oversees the functioning of Perioperative Services, including setting and meeting goals, the surgical schedule, staffing, capital planning (facilities and technology), information systems management, and statistical/financial reporting.  Creates an environment of shared decision-making and promotes staff and physician participation in related initiatives.  Prioritizes improvement initiatives, determines performance measures and reviews effectiveness of implemented programs.  Collaborates with OR physician and nursing leadership to establish OR efficiency performance measures and implement initiatives designed to achieve institutional goals.  Works with the Senior Director of Nursing to directs and support the Assistant Director of Nursing for Surgical Services and the Assistant Director of Nursing for Prep/PACU to manage staffing in order to attain pre-operative, intra-operative and post-operative programmatic planning and operational activities related to the achievement of productivity goals.  Directs and supports the Administrative Director for Perioperative Services to oversee instrument and scope processing, central sterile, the operations of perfusion services, equipment, and supply chain functions.  Oversees central scheduling, in conjunction with the Senior Director of Nursing, to ensure efficient use of perioperative service areas and procedural locations within JHH.  Plans and develops the Perioperative Services capital budget requests in coordination with department Chairs, Administrators, Directors of Nursing and others, as appropriate.  Coordinates appropriate quality and safety management programs throughout Perioperative Services in order to meet TJC, CMS, HIPAA and other regulatory requirements and to ensure the provision of the highest quality and safest patient care.  Coordinates physician and nursing leadership to develop and implement guidelines for evaluating and awarding use of operating room resources consistent with institutional goals.  Meets routinely with the EVP/COO, Anesthesiologist-in-Chief and Surgeon-in-Chief, Director of Nursing and Administrators for Anesthesiology and Surgery to ensure communication and support of shared goals.  Participates in, and supports OR Committee and other assigned medical/staff committees, as determined.  Represents JHM as a member of professional organizations or health care associations (e.g., COTH, UHC, etc.).  Develops and implements strategic planning for Perioperative Services, in collaboration with Perioperative Leadership and JHHS leadership as that evolves Establishes and utilizes criteria to evaluate performance of OR systems for internal and external benchmarking.  Develops documentation, data collection and reporting tools with the CIO and Director of Surgical Informatics to achieve the determined goals.  Oversees performance metrics

Description and Requirements:
SUMMARY 
Johns Hopkins Medicine created the Office of Business Development and Strategic Alliances (BDSA) to serve as an enterprise 
business unit that works with executive stakeholders, physicians and other providers and staff on driving strategy and growth for major programmatic development and business initiatives, primarily with unaffiliated entities.  BDSA focuses on strategic priorities across Johns Hopkins Medicine in support of growth and development initiatives that include new programs and business ventures,  joint ventures, mergers and acquisitions, and other strategic relationships.  Operationally, BDSA seeks to ensure the necessary structure and coordination for opportunity analysis, assessment, strategic context and rationale, due diligence, financial analysis, partnership formation, and transaction processes align with Johns Hopkins Medicine’s mission and standards of excellence.  
The Director will provide direction and oversight on new business opportunities and strategic initiatives.  The Director will co-lead the development of new relationships and manage day-to-day execution of partnership engagements, due diligence engagements, and assigned projects while guiding and developing individual team members. Description and Requirements:
Sibley Memorial Hospital, located in northwest Washington, D.C., is a 318 licensed beds community hospital member of Johns Hopkins Medicine (JHM) since 2010. Sibley offers surgical, obstetric, psychiatric, oncologic and skilled nursing inpatient services. Its campus is also home to Grand Oaks, an assisted living residence, and the Sibley Renaissance, which houses the Center for Rehabilitative Medicine, Sibley Senior Services, specialty centers, a skilled nursing care unit and a residential Alzheimer’s unit. The Medical Building provides outpatient services including the Sibley Ambulatory Surgery Center, imaging and Sibley Primary Care. Sibley Memorial Hospital includes 200 all-private rooms, a state-of-the-art Emergency Department, a nationally recognized orthopaedics program, expanded women’s and infants’ services to house Washington’s D.C.’s busiest maternity program and the Johns Hopkins Kimmel Cancer Center. The Kimmel Cancer Center brings local access to world-renowned oncology experts, clinical trials, cancer treatment and patient and caregiver support to the greater Washington area. The Center is also home to the Johns Hopkins National Proton Therapy Center and our pediatric radiation oncology program in collaboration with the Children’s National Hospital, the only program of its kind in D.C.
Position Summary: Executive Director HR for Sibley Memorial Hospital is responsible for planning, directing, managing and guiding the overall functions and programs for the Human Resources Division and Occupational Health at Sibley Memorial Hospital. Executive Director HR  is a member of the Executive Leadership Team with strategic oversight to embed Human Resource skills into the core competencies of roles across the organization.  A facilitator, principally through empowering technologies (both digital and procedural) that emphasize employee self-service and manager independence; a designer, helping implement high performance people strategies in partnership with line staff and an educator, serving as a catalyst for learning and communication. Develop mechanisms that positively affect the needs of a diversified workforce.  Ensure HR practices and programs are within federal and state regulations.  Executive Director HR collaborates with Central HR in creating, implementing and evaluating innovative recruitment, compensation, benefits and OD&T programs/services that recruit, develop and retain the best talent.
 Reporting relationshipsReports directly to SVP and Chief Human Resources Officer for the Johns Hopkins Medicine, and works in collaboration and in advisory role for the President of the hospital.  
 Essential/Primary Functions:
 Participates as part of the Hospital’s executive management team in formulating overall strategies, goals, and objectives of the institution and develops plans to promote these goals. Functions as an expert consultant to management on a wide variety of human resources issues. Develops, directs, and implements through subordinate personnel and managers, human resources programs in talent acquisition, employment, employee/labor relations, compensation, benefits, training and development, career development, human resources information systems, EEO/Affirmative Action and employee health. Provides leadership and guidance for diversity and inclusion initiatives at the Hospital to foster a more inclusive culture and environment.
